page.title: 05SCHOOL VISITS
page.content: We had a walk around the village and found that many houses were made of stone. We saw a Victorian post box and the war memorial with a sign on it which said 'In memory of those who died in the first and second world wars.' There were some almond,rowan and cherry trees growing near the war memorial. Opposite the memorial was St. Mary's church which was built in 1450.On the roof inside the porch there was a carving of a lion's head which was the emblem of the Pomeroy family. Inside the church we saw the very old tomb of the Seymour family. Lord Seymour was the Lord Protector of England and he had eleven children in his family.
